title: Box, 1501–50
description: Rectangular, with hinged, flat-domed cover; wood, covered with two thicknesses of sheet iron pierced in parallel rows of repeating tracery patterns, the borders iron over half-round wire; at one end, elaborate iron lock with long hasp; on each of the broader sides, two loose rings for attaching coffret to saddle bow or to the inside of a large trunk or chest; lined with red velvet.

tombstone.epitaph:
Box, 1501–50.
1501–50. Iron, wood, red velvet lining. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1967-45-23.
